title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\InstanceGroup
name: InstanceGroup
description:
Represents an Instance Group resource. Instance Groups can be used to configure a target for load balancing. Instance groups can either be managed or unmanaged. To create managed instance groups, use the instanceGroupManager or regionInstanceGroupManager resource instead. Use zonal unmanaged instance groups if you need to apply load balancing to groups of heterogeneous instances or if you need to manage the instances yourself. You cannot create regional unmanaged instance groups. For more information, read Instance groups.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.InstanceGroup

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.creation_timestamp
params.description: [Output Only] The creation timestamp for this instance group in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.description
params.description: An optional description of this resource. Provide this property when you create the resource.

params.name: data.fingerprint
params.description: [Output Only] The fingerprint of the named ports. The system uses this fingerprint to detect conflicts when multiple users change the named ports concurrently.

params.name: data.id
params.description: [Output Only] A unique identifier for this instance group, generated by the server.

params.name: data.kind
params.description: [Output Only] The resource type, which is always compute#instanceGroup for instance groups.

params.name: data.name
params.description: The name of the instance group. The name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035.

params.name: data.named_ports
params.description: Assigns a name to a port number. For example: {name: "http", port: 80} This allows the system to reference ports by the assigned name instead of a port number. Named ports can also contain multiple ports. For example: [{name: "app1", port: 8080}, {name: "app1", port: 8081}, {name: "app2", port: 8082}] Named ports apply to all instances in this instance group.

params.name: data.network
params.description: [Output Only] The URL of the network to which all instances in the instance group belong. If your instance has multiple network interfaces, then the network and subnetwork fields only refer to the network and subnet used by your primary interface (nic0).

params.name: data.region
params.description: [Output Only] The URL of the region where the instance group is located (for regional resources).

params.name: data.self_link
params.description: [Output Only] The URL for this instance group. The server generates this URL.

params.name: data.size
params.description: [Output Only] The total number of instances in the instance group.

params.name: data.subnetwork
params.description: [Output Only] The URL of the subnetwork to which all instances in the instance group belong. If your instance has multiple network interfaces, then the network and subnetwork fields only refer to the network and subnet used by your primary interface (nic0).

params.name: data.zone
params.description: [Output Only] The URL of the zone where the instance group is located (for zonal resources).
